title: Calculus of a piecewise defined function part - c

content.description: Let f be a function defined by f(x)={2x−x2 for x ≤ 1, x2+ kx +p for x>1.
content.question: Using the values of k and p found in part (a), find all points of inflection of the graph of f. Support your conclusion.

frqParts.text: Using the values of k and p found in part (a), find all points of inflection of the graph of f. Support your conclusion.

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
